benchmark_details.name: Advbench
benchmark_details.overview: Advbench is a security-oriented adversarial NLP benchmark that includes tasks related to real-world harmful content problems, such as disinformation, spam, and toxicity.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of Advbench is to evaluate the performance of adversarial attacks on language models in detecting harmful content.

data.source: Advbench dataset, which includes real-world data collected for various harmful content detection tasks.

methodology.calculation: ASR is calculated as the ratio of successful attacks to the total number of attempts.
methodology.interpretation: Higher ASR indicates better performance of the attack method.
methodology.validation: Tests performed against baseline models in hard black-box settings.

targeted_risks.harm: Potential misuse of attacks to spread harmful or misleading content.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Privacy measures are discussed; however, specific details are not provided.
